attributes.action: Abolish an archaic method of servcie efficeincy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Please rethink the current policy of measuring ambulance service efficiency, namely Call Connect.

To achieve this standard ambulance trusts are forced into moving the bulk of their resources into large towns and cities, thereby discriminating against the rural population. Although this isn't deliberate, it is unavoidable if trusts are to secure their funding.

Many trusts are also being forced into placing as many paramedics as possible on cars, so a paramedic gets there within 8 minutes. But has to wait ages to get the patient to hospital.

To base ambulance service funding simply on a time basis is unrealistic,discriminatory, unachieveable and places the crews in danger from accident and in danger from accident.

Also the rural population are also tax payers an ddeserve the right to an ambulance just as quickly as the urban population.

We urge a major rethink on this method of measurement. A system that has existed for over 30 years and has not been changed much in all that time. Please consider, a life is not worth a stastistic.
